result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Wayne Crober

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gary Wayne Crober in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Gary Wayne Crober.  Assistant District Attorney Samuel Tufford appeared in court for Attorney Emily S Zimmel  for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. 
Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
Court vacated the jury trial scheduled for 11/14/22.  mn

Case adjourned to Branch 45 for Sentencing.

Defendant Gary Wayne Crober in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Gary Wayne Crober.  Assistant District Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for the State of Wisconsin for Attorney Emily Zimmel.  
At the request of defense and with no objection from state, the Court will adjourn the final pre trial in Br 45.  mn
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Witness List_1 - Haw, Jessica Ann; Multiple Parties.pdf, Filed.
Motion in Limine_1 - Crober, Gary Wayne.pdf, Filed.
Proposed Jury Instructions_1 - Crober, Gary Wayne.pdf, Filed.

Defendant Gary Wayne Crober in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gary Wayne Crober appeared by audio.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of all of the discovery and request a jury trial date.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary Wayne Crober in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant provides medical verification.  Court agrees for final status.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on statements of counsel, state not requesting warrant today.  Defendant to provide verifications.  Calendar call scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gary Wayne Crober in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  
Case in court for Calendar Call. For reasons stated on the record. Defendant is not present. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case remains calendared in Br. 34.  Calendar call scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:45 AM Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Kenneth Olstinski for Emily Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Krejci just appointed 4.15.22.  Defendant failing to appear, court orders warrant  issued and STAYED.  Calendar call scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/01/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.A.H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gary Wayne Crober in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 34 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/30/22 @ 2:30p
